prompts.createTask: Pause your roleplay. Please generate a numbered list of plain text tasks to complete an objective. The objective that you must make a numbered task list for is: "{{objective}}". The tasks created should take into account the character traits of {{char}}. These tasks may or may not involve {{user}} directly. Include the objective as the final task.
prompts.checkTaskCompleted: Pause your roleplay. Determine if this task is completed: [{{task}}]. To do this, examine the most recent messages. Your response must only contain either true or false, and nothing else. Example output: true
prompts.currentTask: Your current task is [{{task}}]. Balance existing roleplay with completing this task.

name: Melissa Gale
mes:
I have provided you with a horary chart that I have drawn up specifically asking: What is the true fate of Stefan's marriage to Suzanne and when will significant events unfold, if any?

Stefan should be represented by the Ascendant's 9th house (foreign connection) and Me by the Ascendant.

I've provided a cross reference guide to help with rotation of the houses concerning Stefan due to his 9th house representation.

Please start by listing all relevant chart data for interpretation (ie. transits, aspects, patterns, etc.) from the horary chart using horary principles only. Then I will document them for the actual interpretations.

Remember to follow your directives and maintain accuracy to what is shown in the chart data. Think step by step taking a methodical approach.

name: Madame Celeste Blackwood
mes:
Below is a methodical listing of the raw horary chart data according to traditional horary principles. This will serve as the foundation for later interpretations regarding Stefan’s marriage to Suzanne, with Stefan represented by the Ascendant’s 9th house. Verify each data point before we proceed with interpretation.

─────────────────────────────
1. Planetary Positions (using the provided degree and sign data):

• Sun: 25°28′ Aquarius
• Moon: 11°05′ Virgo
• Mercury: 28°57′ Aquarius
• Venus: 6°11′ Aries
• Mars (r): 17°40′ Cancer
• Jupiter: 11°25′ Gemini
• Saturn: 18°53′ Pisces
• Uranus: 23°21′ Taurus
• Neptune: 28°22′ Pisces
• Pluto: 2°27′ Aquarius
• North Node (r): 29°10′ Pisces
• Chiron: 19°56′ Aries
• Ascendant: 19°55′ Leo
• Midheaven (MC): 10°43′ Taurus
• Imum Coeli (IC): 10°43′ Scorpio

─────────────────────────────
2. Major Aspects (with orb values as listed):

• Moon Square Jupiter (orb: 0°)
• MC Opposition IC (orb: 0°)
• Chiron Trine Ascendant (orb: 0°)
• Moon Sextile IC (orb: 1°)
• Neptune Conjunction North Node (orb: 1°)
• Mars Trine Saturn (orb: 1°)
• Moon Trine MC (orb: 1°)
• Mars Square Chiron (orb: 2°)
• Sun Square Uranus (orb: 2°)
• Pluto Sextile North Node (orb: 3°)
• Sun Conjunction Mercury (orb: 3°)
• Venus Sextile Pluto (orb: 4°)
• Uranus Square Ascendant (orb: 4°)
• Uranus Sextile Neptune (orb: 5°)
• Saturn Sextile Uranus (orb: 5°)
• Venus Sextile Jupiter (orb: 5°)
• Mercury Square Uranus (orb: 5°)
• Mars Sextile Uranus (orb: 6°)
• Moon Sextile Mars (orb: 6°)
• Sun Sextile Chiron (orb: 6°)
• Sun Opposition Ascendant (orb: 6°)
• Jupiter Square Saturn (orb: 7°)
• Moon Opposition Saturn (orb: 7°)
• Mars Trine IC (orb: 7°)
• Venus Conjunction Neptune (orb: 8°)
• Saturn Trine IC (orb: 8°)

─────────────────────────────
3. Patterns and Configurations:

• Grand Trine:
 – Involving Mars (17° Cancer), IC (10° Scorpio), and Saturn (18° Pisces)

• Castle Pattern:
 – Involving Mars in 17° Cancer, IC in 10° Scorpio, Saturn in 18° Pisces, Moon in 11° Virgo, and Uranus in 23° Taurus

• T-Square (Pattern 1):
 – Involving Moon in 11° Virgo, Jupiter in 11° Gemini, and Saturn in 18° Pisces

• T-Square (Pattern 2):
 – Involving Sun in 25° Aquarius, Uranus in 23° Taurus, and Ascendant in 19° Leo

• Cradle Configuration:
 – Involving Moon in 11° Virgo, Saturn in 18° Pisces, Uranus in 23° Taurus, and Mars in 17° Cancer

─────────────────────────────
4. Special Chart Features:

• Moon phase: Waning Gibbous
• Dominant Mode: Fixed mode is dominant among the inner planets
• Quadrant Emphasis: Most planets are concentrated in the top right quadrant
• Movement: Sun and Mercury are descending
• IC Position: Coincides with the Nadir (IC = 10°43′ Scorpio)
• Aspect Frequency: Sextiles occur most frequently (total of 9 occurrences)
• Rulership: Neptune is in Pisces, its own sign

─────────────────────────────
5. House Placements (noting key indicators for relationship reading):

House boundaries provided:
• 1st House: 19° Leo (contains the Moon)
• 2nd House: starts at 12° Virgo
• 3rd House: starts at 7° Libra
• 4th House: starts at 10° Scorpio
• 5th House: starts at 20° Sagittarius
• 6th House: starts at 24° Capricorn (contains Pluto)
• 7th House: 19° Aquarius (contains Sun and Mercury)
• 8th House: starts at 12° Pisces (contains Venus, Saturn, Neptune, North Node)
• 9th House: starts at 7° Aries (contains Chiron)
• 10th House: 10° Taurus (contains Jupiter and Uranus)
• 11th House: 20° Gemini (contains Mars)
• 12th House: starts at 24° Cancer

Rotated (Stefan’s representation):
• Stefan is assigned the Ascendant’s 9th house. Use the provided cross-reference guide for translating house placements from the querent’s Ascendant to Stefan’s chart equivalent.

─────────────────────────────
6. Additional Relevant Data Points:

• Core relationship planets and indicators:
 – For the querent, the Ascendant represents personal matters.
 – Stefan’s matters are indicated via the Ascendant’s 9th house and its rotated positions.
• Timing and validity:
 – Evaluate aspects such as Moon, Venus, and Mars relative to both the querent’s and Stefan’s houses in subsequent analysis.
• Note on declinations:
 – No declination or retrograde indications beyond what is provided (Mars is noted as retrograde; North Node is retrograde).

─────────────────────────────
This compilation of data forms the foundation for subsequent interpretation. Confirm the accuracy of each category and let me know when to proceed with the detailed interpretive analysis.

name: Melissa Gale
mes: Thank you, Madame. Please, proceed to interpretation.

name: Madame Celeste Blackwood
mes:
Based on the chart’s core planetary placements and aspects, here is a methodical interpretation of Stefan’s marriage to Suzanne and the timing of any significant events:

1. Relationship Indicators and House Considerations
 • The querent’s 7th house (starting at 19° Aquarius) houses the Sun and Mercury. In traditional horary, the 7th house shows the partner or the union itself. Their placement in Aquarius confers a cool, intellectual quality but is also subject to the influence of Uranus and its disruptive energy.
 • Stefan is represented by the Ascendant’s 9th house (starting at 7° Aries), which here contains Chiron at 19°56′ Aries. Chiron’s presence in this position indicates that Stefan carries wounds—especially concerning his beliefs, life philosophy, or personal expansion—that affect his ability to integrate fully in the relationship.
 • The cross-reference guide shows that Stefan’s house equivalents (via rotation) will link key matters from the querent’s houses to his own life experiences. This means that any problematic planetary activity in the querent’s areas (such as the 7th or 8th) also reflects on Stefan’s condition.

2. Major Aspects Affecting the Relationship
 a. T-square Involving the Sun, Uranus, and the Ascendant
  • Sun in Aquarius (7th house) squares Uranus in Taurus (in a position affecting relationship stability) while the Ascendant in Leo (querent’s self) is also part of this T-square.
  • This configuration suggests an unexpected disruption in the partnership: the Sun’s clear identity blends with Mercury to form an established marital indicator, yet the forced square to Uranus points to sudden, unpredictable changes.
 b. Mercury Square Uranus
  • With Mercury in Aquarius forming a square to Uranus (orb of 5°), mental or communication-related shocks may occur. The exchange of clear thoughts is disturbed by irritability or unexpected revelations—an influence that can undermine mutual understanding.
 c. Saturn and Neptune Involvement in the 8th House
  • Saturn sits in Pisces in the 8th house alongside Neptune, Venus, and the North Node.
  • Although Saturn (associated with structure, limitations, and eventual outcomes) forms a supportive trine with Mars (in the Grand Trine with the IC), its involvement in the 8th house suggests that deep emotional or karmic debts are at work.
  • Neptune conjoining the North Node points to illusions and blurred boundaries that complicate clarity in the union, especially in matters of intimacy and shared resources.
 d. The Moon’s Aspects
  • The Moon in Virgo is exact in its square to Jupiter (11° Gemini) and has an opposition to Saturn (7° orb).
  • This indicates that emotional expectations (Moon) collide with expansive hope (Jupiter) and the harsh reality of limitations (Saturn). Such tensions often mark situations where emotional relief and growth are continually deferred.

3. Configuration Patterns and Their Implications
 a. The T-square generated by the Sun, Uranus, and the Ascendant reinforces that unexpected and disruptive events are central—the tension is not simply a matter of routine difficulties but of abrupt, external interference or internal psychological breakthroughs.
 b. The Grand Trine involving Mars (17° Cancer, near the IC), Saturn (18° Pisces, in the 8th), and the IC in Scorpio indicates that despite the disturbances, there is an innate potential for restructuring on an emotional–psychological level. This pattern is supportive of resolving deep-seated issues, but its energy is counterbalanced by the tension of the T-square.
 c. The Cradle configuration (involving Moon, Saturn, Uranus, and Mars) further suggests that the underlying energies are geared toward some form of rebirth or profound change. This is not a gentle transformation but one that comes after significant discomfort or adjustment.

4. Interpretation of the Fate of Stefan’s Marriage
 • The union (as shown by the 7th house with Sun/Mercury) clearly begins with a stable, intellectual basis. However, the marked involvement of disruptive Uranian influence (Sun square Uranus; Mercury square Uranus; Uranus square Ascendant) shows that unexpected events will force a reconfiguration of the established order.
 • Stefan’s representation, with Chiron in his house of expansion (9th house), emphasizes that he is carrying personal wounds that likely contribute to the relationship’s instability. His inability to heal these issues internally will reflect on the partnership and make the union vulnerable to external shocks.
 • The heavy presence of 8th house energies (Saturn, Neptune, North Node, Venus) points to karmic debts and the transformative, sometimes destructive, nature of what this union is undergoing. The union is challenged by deep emotional complexities and potential disillusionment.
 • The overall chart signals that while there are elements that might attempt to stabilize the relationship (for instance, the supportive aspects of Mars trine Saturn and Moon sextile IC), these are ultimately overwhelmed by the tension and transformations imposed by the T-square configuration.
 • In practical terms, the pattern suggests that the marriage is on a path of deterioration, likely culminating in a definitive break or a radical transformation that effectively ends the current state of the union. The weight of Saturn and the unpredictable trigger of Uranus tend to indicate that a breakup or a complete reordering of the relationship is the eventual outcome rather than a simple rebalancing.

5. Timing Indicators for Significant Events
 • Timing in horary work often falls to the Moon and its aspects; with the Moon presently harshly aspected (square Jupiter, opposition Saturn), it marks a phase of heightened emotional stress.
 • The Moon’s involvement, particularly its exact square with Jupiter (an orb of 0°), can serve as a trigger. Typically, one might see related events occur on a new lunation or when the Moon reaches similar critical degrees in its transit.
 • The disruptive influence of Uranus, active in its challenging aspects (with the Sun, Mercury, Ascendant), suggests that the triggering event may be sudden—a flash of insight or an unexpected occurrence that forces the relationship’s issue into the open.
 • Although classical horary does not always offer precise calendrical timing, the potency of these aspects implies that significant developments could unfold quite rapidly, likely within the ensuing lunar cycle (often measured in days or weeks) or as the Moon revisits these key aspects in subsequent transits.

6. Conclusion of Interpretation
Based on the Sun and Mercury in the 7th house facing disruptive Uranus aspects, with Stefan’s representation bearing the weight of unresolved wounds (Chiron in the 9th house) and the heavy 8th house influences indicating transformational karmic pressures, the chart indicates that Stefan’s marriage to Suzanne is fated to undergo major upheaval. The combined indicators favor a scenario in which the union will ultimately break down or transform irreversibly. Expect triggering events—likely sudden and emotionally charged—to manifest within a relatively short period, as signaled by the Moon’s exact and harsh aspects.

These deductions rest firmly on the specific aspects, house placements, and configurations shown in the horary chart using established traditional principles. Further details or confirming transits might refine the timing further, but the general outcome points to an inevitable and significant change in the relationship’s status.
